of computational methods for the identification of cell cycle-regulated genes","additionalRightSideTopWidgets":null,"additionalCssClasses":null,"abstract":"Motivation: \nDNA microarrays have been used extensively to study the cell cycle transcription programme in a number of model organisms. The Saccharomyces cerevisiae data in particular have been subjected to a wide range of bioinformatics analysis methods, aimed at identifying the correct and complete set of periodically expressed genes.\n\nResults: \nHere, we provide the first thorough benchmark of such methods, surprisingly revealing that most new and more mathematically advanced methods actually perform worse than the analysis published with the original microarray data sets. We show that this loss of accuracy specifically affects methods that only model the shape of the expression profile without taking into account the magnitude of regulation. We present a simple permutation-based method that performs better than most existing methods.","description":false,"hasMicroData":false,"isResearch":false,"isFulltext":true,"isSlurp":false,"isNoText":false,"hideAbstract":false,"hideTypeIcons":false,"publicationType":"Article","fileCategory":"Full-text","publicationDate":"Apr 2005","publicationFullDate":"2005-04-01","journal":null,"publicationItemClickMilestone":"za9NNmVN7JsfCG6REFgW8pdsxan_MK-k3t5xl6shzkHPWID68LYbFA","publicationImage":"https:\/\/www.researchgate.net\/images\/template\/default_publication_preview_big.png"},"43130786":{"publicationUid":43130786,"publicationKey":"43130786_Comprehensive_reanalysis_of_transcription_factor_knockout_expression_data_in_Saccharomyces_cerevisiae_reveals_many_new_targets","authorsPartOne":[{"id":39372903,"url":"scientific-contributions\/39372903_Jueri_Reimand","fullname":"J\u00fcri Reimand","imageUrl":"https:\/\/c5.rgstatic.net\/m\/4951093203564\/images\/template\/default\/profile\/profile_default_s.jpg"},{"id":1929252,"url":"profile\/Juan_Vaquerizas","fullname":"Juan M Vaquerizas","imageUrl":"https:\/\/i1.rgstatic.net\/ii\/profile.image\/AS%3A272457315647511%401441970294504_m\/Juan_Vaquerizas.jpg"},{"id":2039781621,"url":"scientific-contributions\/2039781621_Annabel_E_Todd","fullname":"Annabel E. Todd","imageUrl":"https:\/\/c5.rgstatic.net\/m\/4951093203564\/images\/template\/default\/profile\/profile_default_s.jpg"}],"authorsPartTwo":{"id":1583901,"url":"profile\/Jaak_Vilo","fullname":"Jaak Vilo","imageUrl":"https:\/\/i1.rgstatic.net\/ii\/profile.image\/AS%3A272336955899908%401441941598337_m\/Jaak_Vilo.jpg"},"surplusAuthors":1,"url":"publication\/43130786_Comprehensive_reanalysis_of_transcription_factor_knockout_expression_data_in_Saccharomyces_cerevisiae_reveals_many_new_targets","title":"Comprehensive reanalysis of transcription factor knockout expression data in Saccharomyces cerevisiae reveals many new targets","additionalRightSideTopWidgets":null,"additionalCssClasses":null,"abstract":"Transcription factor (TF) perturbation experiments give valuable insights into gene regulation. Genome-scale evidence from\nmicroarray measurements may be used to identify regulatory interactions between TFs and targets. Recently, Hu and colleagues\npublished a comprehensive study covering 269 TF knockout mutants for the yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae. However, the information that can be extracted from this valuable dataset is limited by the method employed to process the\nmicroarray data. Here, we present a reanalysis of the original data using improved statistical techniques freely available\nfrom the BioConductor project. We identify over 100 000 differentially expressed genes\u2014nine times the total reported by Hu\net al. We validate the biological significance of these genes by assessing their functions, the occurrence of upstream TF-binding\nsites, and the prevalence of protein\u2013protein interactions. The reanalysed dataset outperforms the original across all measures,\nindicating that we have uncovered a vastly expanded list of relevant targets. In summary, this work presents a high-quality\nreanalysis that maximizes the information contained in the Hu et al. compendium. The dataset is available from ArrayExpress (accession: E-MTAB-109) and it will be invaluable to any scientist\ninterested in the yeast transcriptional regulatory system.","description":false,"hasMicroData":false,"isResearch":false,"isFulltext":true,"isSlurp":false,"isNoText":false,"hideAbstract":false,"hideTypeIcons":false,"publicationType":"Article","fileCategory":"Full-text","publicationDate":"Apr 2010","publicationFullDate":"2010-04-01","journal":null,"publicationItemClickMilestone":"bd38tETkav0KdSdYhPOadDIq4YSEc_0t8PSv2n2jD_3xNkm6d_UVLw","publicationImage":"https:\/\/www.researchgate.net\/images\/template\/default_publication_preview_big.png"}},"nextOffset":6,"totalItems":33,"loadMoreCount":6,"extendCitationContext":false},"environment":{"page":"publicliterature.PublicPublicationDetails","isAccountLoggedIn":false,"isMobile":false}}});})();
